za.co.twyst.tweetnacl

Class TweetNaCl

  • java.lang.Object
    • za.co.twyst.tweetnacl.TweetNaCl

  • public class TweetNaCl
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for the JNI library functions that wrap the bare TweetNaCl implementation.
    Author:
    Tony Seebregts
    See Also:
    • TweetNaCl
    • NaCl
    • Questions about the NaCL crypto library

      • TweetNaCl

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases any resources acquired by the native library.

        The current implementation does not acquire 'permanent' resources so invoking release when finished with the library is optional, but recommended.

      • randomBytes

        public void randomBytes(byte[] bytes)
        Wrapper function for randombytes.

        The randombytes function is not part of the TweetNaCl API but is exposed here for test purposes.

        Parameters:
        bytes - byte array to fill with random bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if bytes is null.

      • cryptoBoxKeyPair

        public TweetNaCl.KeyPair cryptoBoxKeyPair()
        Wrapper function for crypto_box_keypair.

        Randomly generates a secret key and a corresponding public key. It guarantees that the secret key has BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES bytes and that the public key has BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES bytes

        Returns:
        KeyPair initialised with a crypto_box public/private key pair.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoBox

        public byte[] cryptoBox(byte[] message,
               byte[] nonce,
               byte[] publicKey,
               byte[] secretKey)
                 throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_box.

        Encrypts and authenticates the message using the secretKey, publicKey and nonce.

        Parameters:
        message - byte array containing the message to be encrypted. May not be null.
        nonce - BOX_NONCEBYTES byte array containing the unique nonce to use when encrypting the message.
        publicKey - BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES byte array containing the public key of the recipient.
        secretKey - BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES byte array containing the secret key of the sender.
        Returns:
        Byte array with the encrypted message.
        Throws:
        EncryptException - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box function returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null
        • nonce is null or not exactly BOX_NONCEBYTES bytes
        • publicKey is null or not exactly BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES bytes
        • secretKey is null or not exactly BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES bytes
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoBoxOpen

        public byte[] cryptoBoxOpen(byte[] ciphertext,
                   byte[] nonce,
                   byte[] publicKey,
                   byte[] secretKey)
                     throws DecryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_box_open.

        Verifies and decrypts the ciphertext using the secretKey, publicKey, and nonce.

        Parameters:
        ciphertext - byte array containing the ciphertext to be decrypted
        nonce - BOX_NONCEBYTES byte array containing the unique nonce to use when encrypting the message.
        publicKey - BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES byte array containing the public key of the recipient.
        secretKey - BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES byte array containing the secret key of the sender.
        Returns:
        Byte array with the plaintext.
        Throws:
        DecryptException - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box_open function returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • ciphertext is null
        • nonce is null or not exactly BOX_NONCEBYTES bytes
        • publicKey is null or not exactly BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES bytes
        • secretKey is null or not exactly BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES bytes
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoBoxBeforeNM

        public byte[] cryptoBoxBeforeNM(byte[] publicKey,
                       byte[] secretKey)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_box_beforenm.

        Calculates a 32 byte shared key for the hashed key-exchange described for curve 25519.

        Applications that send several messages to the same receiver can gain speed by splitting crypto_box into two steps, crypto_box_beforenm and crypto_box_afternm.

        Similarly, applications that receive several messages from the same sender can gain speed by splitting crypto_box_open into two steps, crypto_box_beforenm and crypto_box_afternm_open.

        Parameters:
        publicKey - BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES byte array containing the public key of the recipient.
        secretKey - BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES byte array containing the secret key of the sender.
        Returns:
        BOX_BEFORENMBYTES byte array initialised for use with crypto_box_afternm and crypto_box_afternmopen
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if crypto_box_beforenm returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • publicKey is null or not exactly BOX_PUBLICKEYBYTES bytes
        • secretKey is null or not exactly BOX_SECRETKEYBYTES bytes
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoBoxAfterNM

        public byte[] cryptoBoxAfterNM(byte[] message,
                      byte[] nonce,
                      byte[] key)
                        throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_box_afternm.

        crypto_box_afternm is identical to crypto_secret_box - it takes a BOX_NONCEBYTES byte nonce and a BOX_BEFORENMBYTES byte key and generates an authenticated stream cipher. The first 32 bytes of the output are used for the MAC, the rest are XOR'd with the plaintext to encrypt it.

        Parameters:
        message - byte array containing the message to be encrypted. May not be null.
        nonce - BOX_NONCEBYTES byte array containing the unique nonce to use when encrypting the message.
        key - BOX_BEFORENMBYTES byte array containing the byte array initialised by crypto_box_beforenm.
        Returns:
        Byte array with the encrypted message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box_afternm returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null
        • nonce is null or not exactly BOX_NONCEBYTES bytes
        • key is null or not exactly BOX_BEFORENMBYTES bytes
        EncryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoBoxOpenAfterNM

        public byte[] cryptoBoxOpenAfterNM(byte[] ciphertext,
                          byte[] nonce,
                          byte[] key)
                            throws DecryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_box_open_afternm.

        crypto_box_open_afternm is identical to crypto_secret_box_open - it takes a BOX_NONCEBYTES byte nonce and a BOX_BEFORENMBYTES byte key and generates an authenticated stream cipher. The first 32 bytes of the output are used for the MAC, the rest are XOR'd with the ciphertext to decrypt it.

        Parameters:
        ciphertext - byte array containing the encrypted message to be encrypted.
        nonce - BOX_NONCEBYTES byte array containing the unique nonce to use when encrypting the message.
        key - BOX_BEFORENMBYTES byte array containing the byte array initialised by crypto_box_beforenm.
        Returns:
        Byte array with the encrypted message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box_afternm returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • ciphertext is null
        • nonce is null or not exactly BOX_NONCEBYTES bytes
        • key is null or not exactly BOX_BEFORENMBYTES bytes
        DecryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/box.html

      • cryptoCoreHSalsa20

        public byte[] cryptoCoreHSalsa20(byte[] in,
                        byte[] key,
                        byte[] constant)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_core_hsalsa20.

        From the available documentation crypto_core_hsalsa20 seemingly calculates an intermediate key for encrypting and authenticating packets. The intermediate key is calculated from a secret key and shared secret.

        Parameters:
        in - HSALSA20_INPUTBYTES byte array containing the shared secret.
        key - HSALSA20_KEYBYTES byte array containing the secret key.
        constant - HSALSA20_CONSTBYTES byte array containing an apparently arbitrary 'constant' (IV ?) to be used for the intermediate key calculation.
        Returns:
        HSALSA20_OUTPUTBYTES bytes with the intermediate key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box_hsalsa20 returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • in is null
        • key is null or not exactly HSALSA20_INPUTBYTES bytes
        • constant is null or not exactly HSALSA20_CONSTBYTES bytes

      • cryptoCoreSalsa20

        public byte[] cryptoCoreSalsa20(byte[] in,
                       byte[] key,
                       byte[] constant)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_core_salsa20.

        From the available documentation crypto_core_salsa20 seemingly calculates an intermediate key for encrypting and authenticating packets. The intermediate key is calculated from a secret key and shared secret.

        Parameters:
        in - SALSA20_INPUTBYTES byte array containing the shared secret.
        key - SALSA20_KEYBYTES byte array containing the secret key.
        constant - SALSA20_CONSTBYTES byte array containing an apparently arbitrary 'constant' (IV ?) to be used for the intermediate key calculation.
        Returns:
        SALSA20_OUTPUTBYTES bytes with the intermediate key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_box_hsalsa20 returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • in is null
        • key is null or not exactly SALSA20_INPUTBYTES bytes
        • constant is null or not exactly SALSA20_CONSTBYTES bytes

      • cryptoHash

        public byte[] cryptoHash(byte[] message)
                  throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_hash.

        Calculates a SHA-512 hash of the message.

        Parameters:
        message - message to be hashed.
        Returns:
        HASH_BYTES byte array with the message hash.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_hash returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null
        EncryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/hash.html

      • cryptoHashBlocks

        public byte[] cryptoHashBlocks(byte[] state,
                      byte[] blocks)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_hashblocks.

        Undocumented anywhere, but seems to be a designed to calculate the SHA-512 hash of a stream of blocks.

        Parameters:
        state - current hash 'state'. Seemingly initialised to the initialisation vector for the first block in a stream and thereafter the 'state' returned from a previous call to crypto_hash_blocks.
        Returns:
        block byte array with length a multiple of HASHBLOCKS_BLOCKBYTES to add to the hash.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_hash_blocks returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • state is null or not exactly HASHBLOCKS_STATEBYTES bytes
        • blocks is null or not a multiple of exactly HASHBLOCKS_BLOCKBYTES bytes
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/hash.html

      • cryptoOneTimeAuth

        public byte[] cryptoOneTimeAuth(byte[] message,
                       byte[] key)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_onetimeauth.

        Uses the supplied secret key to calculate an authenticator for the message.

        Parameters:
        message - message requiring an authenticator.
        key - secret key to be used to generate an authenticator.
        Returns:
        ONETIMEAUTH_BYTES bytes array containing the authenticator for the message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_onetimeauth returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null
        • key is null or not exactly ONETIMEAUTH_KEYBYTES bytes.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/onetimeauth.html

      • cryptoOneTimeAuthVerify

        public boolean cryptoOneTimeAuthVerify(byte[] authenticator,
                              byte[] message,
                              byte[] key)
        Wrapper function for crypto_onetimeauth_verify.

        Uses the supplied secret key to verify the authenticator for the message.

        Parameters:
        authenticator - authenticator to verify against message and secret key.
        message - message requiring an authenticator.
        key - secret key to be used to verify an authenticator.
        Returns:
        true if the authenticator is valid,false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null
        • authenticator is null or not exactly ONETIMEAUTH_BYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly ONETIMEAUTH_KEYBYTES bytes.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/onetimeauth.html

      • cryptoScalarMultBase

        public byte[] cryptoScalarMultBase(byte[] n)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_scalarmult_base.

        Computes the scalar product of a standard group element and an integer n.

        Parameters:
        n - integer with which to multiply the standard group element
        Returns:
        Group element calculated from the scalar multiplication of n and a standard group element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_scalarmult_base returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • n is null or not exactly SCALARMULT_SCALARBYTES bytes.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/scalarmult.html

      • cryptoScalarMult

        public byte[] cryptoScalarMult(byte[] n,
                      byte[] p)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_scalarmult.

        Computes the scalar product of a group element p and an integer n.

        Parameters:
        n - scalar with which to multiply the group element
        p - group element with which to multiply the scalar
        Returns:
        Group element calculated from the scalar multiplication of n and p.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_scalarmult returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • n is null or not exactly SCALARMULT_SCALARBYTES bytes.
        • p is null or not exactly SCALARMULT_BYTES bytes.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/scalarmult.html

      • cryptoSecretBox

        public byte[] cryptoSecretBox(byte[] message,
                     byte[] nonce,
                     byte[] key)
                       throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_secretbox.

        Encrypts and authenticates a message using the supplied secret key and nonce.

        Parameters:
        message - message to be encrypted and authenticated
        nonce - unique nonce to use for encryption and authentication
        key - secret key to use for encryption and authentication
        Returns:
        ciphertext with prepended message authenticator
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_secretbox returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null.
        • nonce is null or not exactly SECRETBOX_NONCEBYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly SECRETBOX_KEYBYTES bytes.
        EncryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/secretbox.html

      • cryptoSecretBoxOpen

        public byte[] cryptoSecretBoxOpen(byte[] ciphertext,
                         byte[] nonce,
                         byte[] key)
                           throws DecryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_secretbox_open.

        Verifies and decrypts the ciphertext using the supplied secret key and nonce.

        Parameters:
        ciphertext - encrypted message to be verified and decrypted
        nonce - unique nonce to use for verification and decryption
        key - secret key to use for verification and decryption
        Returns:
        decrypted message
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_secretbox_open returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • ciphertext is null.
        • nonce is null or not exactly SECRETBOX_NONCEBYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly SECRETBOX_KEYBYTES bytes.
        DecryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/secretbox.html

      • cryptoStream

        public byte[] cryptoStream(int length,
                  byte[] nonce,
                  byte[] key)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Wrapper function for crypto_stream.

        Produces a length stream as a function of the key and nonce.

        Parameters:
        length - number of stream bytes to generate
        nonce - unique nonce to use to generate stream
        key - secret key to use to generate stream
        Returns:
        'stream' byte array
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_stream returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • length is less than 0.
        • nonce is null or not exactly STREAM_NONCEBYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly STREAM_KEYBYTES bytes.
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/stream.html

      • cryptoStreamXor

        public byte[] cryptoStreamXor(byte[] message,
                     byte[] nonce,
                     byte[] key)
                       throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_stream_xor.

        Encrypts a message using a secret key and a nonce. The returned ciphertext is the plaintext XOR with the output of the stream generated by crypto_stream with the secret key and nonce.

        Parameters:
        message - message to encrypt
        nonce - unique nonce to use to generate stream
        key - secret key to use to generate stream
        Returns:
        ciphertext
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_stream_xor returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • message is null.
        • nonce is null or not exactly STREAM_NONCEBYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly STREAM_KEYBYTES bytes.
        EncryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/stream.html

      • cryptoStreamSalsa20

        public byte[] cryptoStreamSalsa20(int length,
                         byte[] nonce,
                         byte[] key)
                           throws EncryptException
        Wrapper function for crypto_stream_salsa20.

        Uses Salsa20 as the underlying cipher to produces a length stream as a function of the key and nonce.

        Parameters:
        length - number of stream bytes to generate
        nonce - unique nonce to use to generate stream
        key - secret key to use to generate stream
        Returns:
        'stream' byte array
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the wrapped crypto_stream_salsa20 returns anything other than 0.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if:
        • length is less than 0.
        • nonce is null or not exactly STREAM_SALSA20_NONCEBYTES bytes.
        • key is null or not exactly STREAM_SALSA20_KEYBYTES bytes.
        EncryptException
        See Also:
        http://nacl.cr.yp.to/stream.html
